content.description: Fun moves up a left-trending slabby ramp lead to the crux headwall where a sequential series of edges gain the anchors.
content.location:
Right of center between

Conjunction Junction

and

Interplanet Janet

at an obvious left-slanting ramp.

content.description:
Well protected route with bolts often, protecting every more difficult move.  Key holds around the crux section are bolted and glued in, giving the climb a weird feel.

Belay position is annoying as the ground level is all loose sand and very steep.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with rap rings
content.location: Start at the far right side of Schoolhouse Rock, up the loose sand/rock path.  First bolt is 6' off the ground just above a slight lip.

content.description: Balancy and technical for the area. The difficult moves are always right after a clip making it a great route to break into the grade.
content.location:
Just right of the staircased section with

The Energy Blues

.

content.description: This route is OK for the grade, but not nearly as good as several surrounding routes. There are several fairly large loose blocks that are wedged on this climb that would be very detrimental to the belayer if they get yarded out. With that being said, it's worth doing if you're there.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chain anchors (rap or lower off)
content.location:
Share's the start of

The Energy Blues

and verges right towards the arete on the slab section. The crux is up high and is pulling onto the arete to get up to final bolt and anchors.

Schoolhouse Rock, Riverside Quarry  A. Schoolhouse Rock (5.8) B. The Check's in the Mail (5.7) C. The Energy Blues (5.6) D. Taxman Max (5.5) E. Dollars and Sense (5.7) F. Tyrannosaurus Debt (5.9) G. I'm Just a Bill (5.6) H. My Hero Zero (5.0) I. Conjunction Junction (5.9) J. Function Junction (5.9) K. What's Your Function (5.10b) L. Interplanet Janet (5.6) M. House of Cards (5.10c) N. Victim of Gravity (5.9)

content.description:
Low-angled slab leads up to a bulge (crux) which is passed using some inobvious holds. Higher continue up the slab past several overlaps before reaching the anchors.

The climb ends somewhat below the top to keep on the good rock and away from some dangerously loose blocks.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chain anchors. Long slings can be helpful on some of the bolts.
content.location:
Left-most bolted line and left of

The Check's in the Mail

.

content.description: Climb a low-angled slab to headwall which is turned via a reachy move then romp up easy face to a final bulge before the anchors. Not terribly exciting but perhaps worth doing while the rope is hanging from the anchors.
Great route to learn to lead on or for kids.  Lots of clips and easy climbing, but not a walk up.
content.location: Just right of the short finger crack.  Lower off.

content.description: Start in a clean right-facing corner and then up and left on a slab to access a huge lieback flake which leads to an upper face and anchors. Quality.
content.location: Right of center and the third route from the right.

content.description: Super fun little route with a finger crack and balancy friction.
content.location: Goes right up through a short finger crack and over a bulge.

content.description:
Climb past a low first bolt to a slabby apron then tackle the small roof directly via reachy and awkward moves before wandering up scaly face and cracks to shared anchors with

Victim of Gravity

.
content.location:
Just left of

Victim of Gravity

at the right end of the wall.

content.description: Fun route with a slightly overhanging crux that leads up on solid (i.e. reinforced) crimps.  Follow the left bolts near the top.
Start in the recessed area and climb the slab that steepens to a bulge at the top. Fun moves on good rock and one of the best at the grade in the area.
content.location: Third route from the left and starting from a recessed area.

content.description: Interesting little route that is kind of a one move wonder.  Crux is pulling onto the face about halfway up, after that it's gravy.
content.location: Follows the right arete next to the slabby staircased seciton.

content.description:
Climb a short slab to a ledge, continue up the slabby apron above and then tackle the crux headwall above on positive edges.

The last two bolts of this route are shared with

Function Junction

which comes in from the right.
content.location:
Right of center between

My Hero Zero

and

Function Junction

.

content.description:
Low-angled slab leads up to a bulge (crux) which is pulled using face holds and the arete. After the second bolt continue up the slabby arete past two more bolts to join

The Energy Blues

for it's last three bolts.
content.protection:
7 bolts, anchors (shared with

The Energy Blues

)

Slings are helpful on some of the bolts to cut down on rope-drag and protect the rope from running over any rough edges.
